author: KunalL-79
title: Outstanding
text:
Dhurandhar is a powerful, engaging, and thoroughly entertaining film that succeeds in delivering a complete cinematic experience. From the very beginning, the movie establishes a strong grip over the audience with its intense tone, sharp storytelling, and confident direction. It does not waste time in unnecessary build-up and quickly draws viewers into its world.

The biggest strength of Dhurandhar lies in its lead performance. The protagonist dominates the screen with a perfect balance of raw aggression and emotional depth. His body language, dialogue delivery, and screen presence elevate the character and make it memorable. This is not just loud heroism; it is grounded, convincing, and impactful. The supporting cast complements the lead well, each character having a clear purpose and contributing meaningfully to the narrative.

The direction deserves special appreciation. The filmmaker maintains a tight grip on the storyline, ensuring that every scene pushes the plot forward. There are no unnecessary distractions, and the pacing remains largely consistent. The film smartly balances action and emotion, preventing it from becoming either too chaotic or overly sentimental.

Action sequences are well-choreographed and realistic, focusing more on intensity than exaggerated stunts. These scenes feel earned and serve the story rather than existing merely for visual spectacle. The background score is another major highlight-it enhances tension, amplifies emotions, and adds weight to key moments, making several scenes truly goosebump-worthy.

Emotionally, Dhurandhar strikes the right notes. The struggles, motivations, and conflicts of the characters feel relatable, which helps the audience connect on a deeper level. The dialogues are sharp and impactful, with several lines leaving a lasting impression.

Visually, the film is well-crafted with strong cinematography that complements the gritty tone of the story. The overall production quality reflects sincerity and effort, adding to the film's immersive experience.

In conclusion, Dhurandhar is a well-made, hard-hitting entertainer that blends action, emotion, and strong performances effectively. It caters to mass audiences while retaining substance, making it a paisa-vasool film and a must-watch for anyone who enjoys intense, character-driven cinema.

author: Movie_Watcher13
title: Dhurandhar: Brain-Off Action Bliss (8/10)
text: Dhurandhar (2025) is a gripping spy action thriller that earns its 8/10 rating by delivering a tense, immersive experience filled with layered performances, masterful direction, and a politically charged narrative that demands attention from start to finish. Story and DirectionThe film, directed by Aditya Dhar, follows Hamza (Ranveer Singh), a young RAW agent thrust into a covert operation in Karachi's dangerous Lyari town. The story traces the intricate nexus of crime, politics, and terror, with Dhar's direction ensuring every sequence-whether action-packed or contemplative-feels vital and purposeful. The pacing builds gradually, rewarding patience with a payoff that is both emotionally and narratively satisfying. PerformancesRanveer Singh delivers arguably the best performance of his career, balancing intensity, vulnerability, and moral complexity. Akshaye Khanna stands out with a compelling portrayal, while the supporting cast adds depth and authenticity to the film's criminal ecosystem. The ensemble's chemistry and commitment elevate the storytelling, making the world feel lived-in and believable. Cinematography and SoundVikash Nowlakha's cinematography plunges viewers into the gritty alleys of Lyari, capturing both the chaos and intimacy of the setting. The background score by Shashwat Sachdev is a pulsating heartbeat that maintains tension throughout, enhancing the film's immersive quality. Every shot is meticulously crafted, setting a new benchmark for the genre. Strengths and WeaknessesDhurandhar excels in its blend of action, suspense, and political intrigue, with adrenaline-pumping set pieces balanced by quieter, character-driven moments. The film's only minor flaw is its long runtime, which some may find cumbersome, but every minute is justified by ambitious world-building and layered storytelling. The narrative's climax is a masterclass in suspense, leaving audiences eager for the sequel. Final VerdictDhurandhar is a no-brainer for fans of action thrillers and political dramas. With powerhouse performances, technical brilliance, and a story that resonates long after the credits roll, it stands as one of Bollywood's strongest releases of 2025.

author: ShreejitM
title: Awesome theatrical experience
text: Such an amazing movie, I was shocked to see that bollywood can be this good, from the color grading to tone of the movie to the soundtracks and the story, everything is perfectly blended. Absolute cinematic experience in theatre. You won't feel the long runtime of the movie, it keeps you that hooked. Can't wait for part-2.

author: atharvpatil
title: Refreshing spy tale
text:
The movie portrays reality but blends it with a fair amount of Bollywood-style masala, which actually works in its favour most of the time. The director has set the tone brilliantly, ensuring that the film maintains a balance between serious moments and commercial entertainment. Although some dialogues come across as slightly cringe-worthy, they are still far better than what we usually get from big franchise films like the YRF Spy Universe. At least here, the lines feel more grounded and contribute to the overall mood of the story rather than trying too hard to sound "cool."

The music in the film is surprisingly enjoyable. The songs are catchy, well-placed, and enhance the emotional beats without feeling forced. The background score also complements the intensity and keeps the audience engaged. Acting-wise, the cast delivers solid performances across the board. A special mention definitely goes to Akshaye Khanna, Ranveer, and R. Madhavan, who stand out with their impressive and compelling portrayals. Each of them brings depth and nuance to their character, making their scenes some of the most memorable in the entire film.

What makes the movie even more appealing is that the screen time doesn't feel dragged. Despite its length, the pacing is well-managed, and I found myself genuinely enjoying the experience throughout. There were hardly any moments where I felt the narrative slowed down unnecessarily. Whether it was due to the performances, the music, or the overall energy of the film, it kept me invested from start to finish.

Overall, the movie succeeds in delivering an entertaining and engaging cinematic experience. It may not be perfect, but it offers enough compelling moments, strong performances, and enjoyable music to make it worth watching.

author: JOYG-101
title: A one of the most most and most best film of my life
text:
Dhurandhar (2025) redefines Indian spy thrillers with its unflinching gaze into the shadows of terror. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film plunges viewers into Operation Dhurandhar, where Ranveer Singh's Hamza Ali Mazari-a fierce Intelligence Bureau operative-infiltrates Karachi's brutal Lyari ganglands. Inspired by real events like the Kandahar hijacking and 26/11 attacks, Hamza poses as a local gangster to dismantle terror networks linked to Pakistan's underworld and ISI, navigating savage rivalries, betrayals, and a forbidden romance with Elina (Sara Arjun).

Ranveer Singh delivers his career-best performance, feral and layered, blending raw intensity with haunting vulnerability as Hamza grapples with moral dilemmas and personal ghosts. Akshaye Khanna's chilling Rehman Dakait exudes menace, while R. Madhavan's steely IB Director Ajay Sanyal and Sanjay Dutt's commanding presence elevate the ensemble. Arjun Rampal adds quiet intimidation. Dhar masterfully balances a deliberate slow-burn buildup-mapping crime-politics-terror nexuses-with explosive action in the 214-minute runtime, every frame pulsing with tension.

Cinematography captures Karachi's gritty alleys in mesmerizing detail, paired with a score that amplifies dread and triumph. Though pacing draws minor critique amid political undertones dividing audiences in India and Pakistan, the film's immersive world-building, strategic depth, and heart-pounding climactic twists make it 2025's box-office king, priming for Part 2. A gritty masterpiece that grips like a vice-unmissable for thrill-seekers.

author: krharshsj
title: #DhurandharReview: A Razor-Sharp, Explosive Triumph - 4.5/5
text:
Aditya Dhar doesn't just adapt real events - he weaponises them. Dhurandhar is a masterclass in connecting chillingly authentic dots from India's covert history - things we know and those we don't - and then draping them in blistering fiction so seamless that you'll spend the entire runtime wondering which parts Dhar pulled from classified files (and which "great connections" handed him the keys). Wink or not, the illusion is devastatingly effective.

This is lean, mean espionage cinema that refuses to waste a single second. No forced romance, no pointless subplots, no heroic monologues in the rain - just relentless forward momentum. The pacing is ferocious: never non-stop edge-of-the-seat (it breathes when it needs to), yet never, ever boring. When the bullets fly, the action is bone-crunching and brilliantly choreographed; when the silence falls, it's heavier than any explosion.

The score? An absolute beast - throbbing, patriotic, and cleverly laced with punchy callbacks to Sunny Deol's roaring 90s era (those remixed hooks hit like nostalgia grenades). If there's one minor gripe, it's that the sound mix occasionally lets the music drown out dialogue, but honestly, you'll be too pumped to care.

Acting is on a different planet. The legends on screen (you know exactly who they are) deliver performances that remind you why they're legends - raw power, zero vanity, total command. @RanveerOfficial fights valiantly, but he's comfortably overshadowed by the heavyweights around him.(@duttsanjay, Akshay Khanna @ActorMadhavan) Even smaller roles shine: Rakesh Bedi is a revelation, Sara Arjun carries her emotional track with startling maturity, and quiet fire.

Yet the night undeniably belongs to Aditya Dhar. From #Uri to this, he has perfected the art of building high-stakes thrillers on the skeleton of real incidents without ever letting the joins show. Every revelation feels earned, every twist organic, every emotional beat gut-punching. He turns potential mess into surgical precision.

Dhurandhar isn't just one of the best espionage films Bollywood has ever produced - it's a roaring statement that Aditya Dhar is operating on a level few can touch.

March 2026 sequel? Take my money now.

Verdict: 4.5/5 - Mandatory big-screen experience. Bring earplugs if you're sensitive to loud glory.

author: kabir55
title: Epic Storytelling with a Stellar Lineup
text: From the outset, the narrative immerses viewers in a world of calculated danger and suspense. The lead's performance captures vulnerability, courage, and moral conflict with finesse. Action sequences are intense, realistic, and narratively purposeful. Cinematography highlights contrasts between stillness and chaos, while sound design amplifies tension. Supporting roles enrich the story with depth and nuance. The screenplay develops gradually, building tension and intrigue naturally. By the climax, every plot thread converges into a thrilling and emotionally satisfying resolution. This is cinematic storytelling at its finest-intelligent, immersive, and electrifying.

author: SourikB-5
title: Based fr
text:
The true measure of a masterpiece is its ability to defy expectations, and Dhurandhar achieves this by making its considerable runtime of over three hours feel remarkably fleet. It is a cinematic anomaly: a long cinema where, as the viewer, you might truly never know how the time passes. Director Aditya Dhar crafts an experience so immersive, the clock simply ceases to matter. For me it's a banger of 2025.

This is fundamentally an action thriller, but its lasting impact comes from its intellectual depth. You noted that everything about the film and every second of the script compliment each other, and this is the film's greatest triumph. It meticulously builds a complex web of geopolitics, personal trauma, and covert operations, where no plot thread feels wasted. This cohesive storytelling elevates the film beyond a simple revenge or rescue narrative.

The movie's aesthetics are fiercely compelling-it is unequivocally eye-popping. Yet, this spectacle is balanced by a subtle palate in the script's approach to moral complexity and the psychology of its characters. Ranveer Singh delivers a career-high performance of controlled intensity, perfectly complemented by the chilling, calculating restraint of Akshaye Khanna. Their confrontation grounds the grand scale in human stakes.

While some critics may point to the film's ambition stretching its length, Dhurandhar is a powerful, detailed, and engrossing epic. It's a patriotic action film that doesn't sacrifice intelligence for adrenaline. It is, without question, a must watch.

author: shibashishbehera
title: Dhuaandar Dhu-Ran-Dhar üî•üî•üî•
text:

author: Maddy-055
title: Isn't just a film; it's a statement. A well-acted, tightly executed, and unforgettable one.
text:
Dhurandhar arrives like a thunderclap, a film that refuses to blink in the face of geopolitical reality and instead delivers a gripping narrative with cinematic finesse. At the heart of the film stands Akshaye Khanna, whose performance is nothing short of extraordinary. He doesn't just act; he inhabits the frame with a calm ferocity, delivering a portrayal so controlled and layered that it becomes the emotional axis of the entire film. His presence elevates every scene, and his precision adds a gravity that lingers long after the credits roll.

Ranveer Singh brings an electric edge to his character, embodying both urgency and charisma with his trademark intensity. His role balances Khanna's stoic brilliance with a kinetic energy that keeps the film's pulse racing. Their dynamic together is one of the movie's most rewarding strengths.

Arjun Rampal (my favorite actor), though given limited screen time, leaves a deep imprint. His performance is sharp and dignified, the kind that makes you wish the script had carved out more room for him. Even in a few scenes, he proves why he remains one of the industry's most compelling presences.

Beyond the performances, Dhurandhar stands out for its unapologetic commitment to truth-telling. The film boldly addresses Pakistan's support of terrorist organizations, presenting the narrative with clarity, research-backed nuance, and moral courage. It captures the geopolitical climate with an honesty rarely attempted in mainstream cinema, turning complex realities into powerful storytelling. Adding real footage from 26/11 and conversations between terrorists triangulated the truth claims made by the film.

Dhurandhar isn't just a film; it's a statement. A well-acted, tightly executed, and unforgettable one.

author: amanver-33758
title: Dhurandhar: A Fearless Truth on Screen
text: Dhurandhar grips with confident storytelling and uncompromising honesty. The film's core theme-that every event, motive, and detail presented is absolutely correct-is conveyed with clarity and conviction. Powerful performances, taut pacing, and authentic visuals make the narrative feel lived-in and credible. It challenges, informs, and resonates, leaving the audience with the sense that truth, when told boldly, is the most compelling cinema.

author: Ganesh-7991
title: Crafted with scale, soul, and unshakeable star presence
text: The narrative's strength lies in its layered construction, combining high-stakes action with complex character arcs and political intrigue. Ranveer Singh's performance is compelling, embodying both intensity and vulnerability, making his journey relatable despite extreme circumstances. The director's precision ensures that tension never wanes, with each scene building toward a calculated crescendo. Secondary characters are well-developed, and even brief appearances carry weight. Cinematic visuals and thoughtful lighting elevate every moment, while the soundtrack underscores rather than dominates. Editing skillfully maintains pace, weaving multiple threads seamlessly. The film's climax is both shocking and emotionally satisfying, reflecting the carefully laid groundwork of the story. It's a cinematic experience that resonates far beyond the theater.

author: ankit-7241
title: The storytelling is gripping and well-paced, with strong performances that keep you emotionally invested throughout
text:
I watched Dhurandhar and found it truly outstanding. Despite its long runtime of around 3.5 hours, the movie never once felt boring. Every minute was engaging, which is a rare achievement for a film of this length.

The storytelling is gripping and well-paced, with strong performances that keep you emotionally invested throughout. The screenplay is smart, the direction is confident, and the narrative keeps unfolding in a way that constantly holds your attention. The film balances drama, emotion, and intensity beautifully, making the experience feel immersive rather than exhausting.

What impressed me the most is how the movie sustains interest from start to finish without unnecessary drag. Each scene feels purposeful, and the buildup leads to a satisfying payoff. Dhurandhar is a well-crafted, powerful film that proves length doesn't matter when the content is compelling and far better than the worst time wasting movie like the tiger's, Pathaan and war .

Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys meaningful and engaging cinema.

author: kaushalchina
title: üö® Mind-Shattering Masterpiece! Dhurandhar Will Leave You Speechless and Begging for Part 2! üî•
text:
OMG, where do I even start? Dhurandhar just blew my mind completely - this is hands down the BEST spy thriller Bollywood has EVER produced! I went in expecting a good action film, but what I got was a jaw-dropping revelation that had me shocked from the very first frame. How were we all so unaware of these insane real-life inspired events happening right under our noses? The way the movie exposes betrayals at the highest levels - Indian politicians and insiders secretly helping Pakistan pull off devastating attacks like the IC-814 hijack, Parliament attack, and 26/11 - it's chilling, eye-opening, and makes your blood boil with patriotic fire!

Ranveer Singh is on another level as the undercover agent - his transformation, intensity, and raw power will give you goosebumps every single scene. But hold up... Akshaye Khanna? ABSOLUTE STEALER OF THE SHOW! As the ruthless gangster Rehman Dakait, his swag, menacing aura, and dialogue delivery are pure fire - he's giving a career-best performance that's unforgettable! The entire cast - R. Madhavan, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal - brings so much depth and menace, making every betrayal and twist hit harder.

Aditya Dhar's direction is genius: brutal action that's realistic and heart-pounding, immersive cinematography in the gritty Lyari underworld, and Shashwat Sachdev's throbbing score that keeps the tension sky-high for over 3 hours (and trust me, it NEVER drags!). This is bold, ambitious cinema that redefines the genre - patriotic, gripping, and unapologetic.

If you're a fan of intense thrillers, RUN to the theaters NOW for the full big-screen impact! This isn't just a movie; it's an experience that'll stay with you forever. Can't wait for Part 2 - Dhurandhar is a GAME-CHANGER! üáÆüá≥üî• #Dhurandhar #MustWatch #BollywoodBlockbuster.

author: ratna2091
title: A True Espionage Thriller After Ages!
text:
A string of loud, star-heavy "spy" films that traded story for spectacle, Dhurandhar finally brings the genre back on track. Despite its big cast, the film relies on strong performances rather than hype. Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, and Ranveer Singh are excellent, but it's Saira and Rakesh Bedi who deliver surprisingly impactful supporting roles.

The espionage elements feel authentic-showing how fragile operations are, how one mistake can derail everything, and how agents often operate on instinct and courage. Blending real incidents with a national perspective, the film taps into genuine emotion and tension without resorting to mindless action.

Though long, it never drags. The pacing, stakes, and performances keep you locked in from start to finish. The violence is present but restrained compared to films like Animal, making it intense but not gratuitous.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a gripping, well-crafted spy thriller that respects both its genre and its audience.

I did not feel the connection but the overall movie was very good .And I personally do not like romantic movies that much , so I would give this movie a 10/10.

author: abhijitdodiya
title: Most Cinematic Indian Spy Thriller
text:
Finally a Great Cinematic Spy Thriller of India.

I just cannot describe how compelling this movie is. The story, the great starcast, their acting, the music, everything from top to bottom is just amazing in this movie.

Aditya Dhar really raised the bar for himself and even the whole Bollywood for that matter. Because this is really a unique movie of its own Indian Cinema has never seen.

Whole movie is great, resilient, violent and intriguing. I just loved it. I really wasn't expecting this much from this movie, I barely touched the trailer or teaser. But the movie really changed my mind.

From start to finish, it's perfect. The way they have handled the characters, connected the dots. Showing some incidents, that too with real footage and gore is really a bold step that I really appreciate.

I am glad that Aditya Dhar took that risk and delivered an S-class Spy Thriller Masterpiece of Indian Cinema.

This story couldn't have been represented better.

The direction, the storytelling, the acting, there are many scenes where it makes you feel for your nation, and the people who have suffered for the nation.

Whether it's from the lead role, or the antagonistic role, the acting and the representation feels so grounded, real, impressive and entertaining in every way.

This is what Indian Cinema should be. This can be the revolutionary step in Indian Cinema. After a big gap I have felt that finally a good Hindi movie that will stay in some best movies of such category - corner of my mind. The title track is still roaming in my mind and some scenes are still playing in my head again and again.

S-tier Cinematic Experience. Really top of the class. Must be experienced in cinemas.

Jai Hind.

author: tripathisamvardhan
title: must watch
text:
Stellar Performances
Ranveer Singh absolutely devours the screen as the feral, intense Hamza, blending raw fury with heartbreaking vulnerability in a role that showcases his insane range. Akshaye Khanna steals every scene he's in with his subtle, heroic brilliance, making you root for his character non-stop. The supporting cast, from Arjun Rampal to R. Madhavan and Sanjay Dutt, adds layers of emotional depth and edge-of-your-seat tension that elevate the whole ensemble
Gripping Storyline
Aditya Dhar crafts a masterful spy thriller inspired by real events, diving deep into India's covert ops against terror with heart-pounding action and smart strategy The world-building in Karachi feels dangerously real, mixing brutal set pieces with moral dilemmas that hit hard It's not just mindless action-it's a tense, immersive ride that balances politics, crime, and human drama flawlessly
Technical Brilliance
Cinematography captures every chaotic fight and quiet moment with precision, while the score amps up the adrenaline perfectly Editing keeps the massive runtime taut, turning potential drags into non-stop thrills Nagpur audiences are raving about it, with uncut public reactions calling it a must-watch theater experience
Box Office Phenomenon
This film's crossed 300 crore on pure audience love, despite bans abroad, proving its unstoppable pull Celebs like Preity Zinta hail it as a masterpiece and love letter to cinema. Ranvir Shorey loved its zero-hate stance except for terror networks-total crowd-pleaser.

text:

author: sonujswl
title: A Story That Hits Hard and Fast
text: The film unfolds like a high-stakes chess game, where every decision has consequences that ripple through its meticulously constructed world. His nuanced expressions convey fear, determination, and vulnerability simultaneously. Sanjay Dutt commands the screen with his gravitas, exuding menace and authority that makes every confrontation tense and riveting. Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan enrich the ensemble with subtlety and intelligence, providing counterpoints that add layers to the story. Arjun Rampal's controlled menace looms large, and Sara Arjun's innocent yet heart-wrenching performance brings emotional grounding. Aditya Dhar orchestrates action and tension masterfully, ensuring that adrenaline-pumping sequences and quiet, strategic moments coexist seamlessly. The cinematography captures Karachi's chaotic beauty and intimate spaces with equal skill, while the score punctuates every twist and turn. The second half escalates with shocking revelations, perfectly timed action, and emotional depth, culminating in a finale that lingers in memory long after the credits roll.

author: abhishekgowdaks
title: Raw, Relentless and Truth
text:
From the very first scene, Akshay Khanna bursts onto the screen with full force pours everything he has into his performance and absolutely commands attention. His portrayal is terrifyingly realistic and intense, feels like he's not acting, but actually living the character. Meanwhile, Ranveer Singh delivers a strong, top-notch performance too, but Akshay Khanna's peak performance overshadows even that.

There's a particular dialogue in the film that reportedly struck a chord - it hit hard for many who sympathize with pak, who can't digest truth are reacting with low ratings purely out of frustration. But putting aside that noise - this film doesn't just deliver on acting. The direction of Aditya Dhar is tight, drawing you into a gritty, immersive underworld, and the background score and overall craft work elevates the tension and atmosphere throughout.

Not just acting, even the storytelling in "Dhurandhar" stand out. The film balances a sprawling, complex narrative and delivers emotional impact along with high-voltage action. For those willing to go along for the ride, it's a cinematic experience that grips you, provokes thought - and refuses to let go.

Honestly - it's not Akshay Khanna who deserves an Oscar; it's the Oscar that deserves Akshay Khanna.

author: aayushm-30430
title: Cinema Meets Geopolitics
text:
We have seen many spy movies in India which are nothing but manohar kahaniyan of Aman ki Asha. After Baahubali, this is the second movie that I watched despite the hype and it truly lived up to it.

Since I closely follow geopolitical news, especially related to Pakistan, this movie will strongly resonate with anyone who keeps an eye on such developments. It effectively connects the dots of the India-Pakistan conflict, Pakistan sponsored terrorism in India, its modules, and the politics and politicians of both countries.

The most impactful element that the writer and director have smartly capitalized on is the concept of "Unknown Gunman Supremacy." It is evident that the creators have studied these aspects in depth and woven them together to build a plot around the background of unknown gunmen, reinforcing India's stance that "India ghar mein ghus ke maarega."

This is not just a movie, it's an experience. A must-watch for every cinema lover. Absolutely deserving 10 out of 10.

author: maheshkulkarnimk
title: Action That Surprises, Drama That Stays
text: Every scene feels meticulously designed, blending high-octane action with character-driven drama. Ranveer Singh's performance is extraordinary, embodying both vulnerability and unyielding determination. The director's vision ensures that the political and underworld dynamics feel authentic and immediate, while the pacing keeps audiences constantly engaged. Action sequences are crisp, innovative, and serve the narrative rather than mere spectacle. The supporting cast adds layers of intrigue and complexity, enhancing the story's believability. Cinematography captures both intimate and large-scale moments with equal skill, complemented by a score that heightens tension and emotion. The film's second half escalates stakes brilliantly, culminating in a climax that is both thrilling and deeply satisfying emotionally.

author: ravinavkumar
title: Awesome me combination of music, plot, story telling and Acting.
text:
I honestly waited a long time for a movie like Dhurandhar, and I'm genuinely glad this one lived up to every expectation and more. It has that perfect balance of phenomenal acting, a gripping plot, and storytelling that keeps you thinking even after walking out of the theatre. Not many films today dare to touch subjects this real and bold, especially when it comes to patriotism. This movie speaks openly about the country - without shame, without over-correction, and without pretending patriotism is something outdated or embarrassing. It says things many Indians have wanted to express but never felt comfortable saying out loud. Huge respect to Aditya Dhar for that brave attempt alone.

Ranveer Singh delivered a controlled and mature performance - impactful without unnecessary exaggeration and completely aligned with the tone of the film.

The supporting cast collectively deserves appreciation. Saumya Tandon was a standout - she brought a calm strength and believable emotional depth that made her character genuinely felt. Akshaye Khanna added sharp intensity and a mysterious edge that kept every scene with him captivating, while R. Madhavan contributed a grounded emotional layer that balanced the film's heavy themes. Together, they lifted the narrative beautifully and made the world of the film feel authentic.

Great music really connected with the plot - not just useless music added like other films

One of the most refreshing things was the music - finally a film where the score and tracks respect the story. No forced dance numbers, no random romance songs - just music that fit the moment, enhanced the impact, and supported the plot instead of distracting from it.

For me, Dhurandhar is a complete package - honest storytelling, committed performances, brave messaging, and music that adds value. This movie restored faith that Indian cinema can still create films with purpose, emotion, and pride. Salute to the team for delivering something bold, thoughtful, and truly memorable.

author: Aapkaashis
title: Dhurandhar - A treat to the audience
text:
9/10 - Dhurandhar is a gripping spy-action thriller with a long runtime that never feels boring, thanks to a strong screenplay and powerful performances. Director Aditya Dhar ensures every character leaves an impact-this isn't just a Ranveer Singh show.

Performances:

Akshay Khanna shines as Rehman Dakait with standout swag and dialogue delivery.

Sanjay Dutt elevates the film's pace with a strong late entry.

Ranveer Singh's character arc is engaging and sets high expectations for Part 2.

R. Madhavan and Arjun Rampal make their limited screen time count.

Sara Arjun delivers a decent performance.

Technical Aspects:

Direction by Aditya Dhar is impactful.

Sashwat Sachdev's music blends perfectly with the tone.

Smart use of old Bollywood songs adds thrill.

Vikash Nowlakha's cinematography and Shivkumar V Panicker's editing are sharp.

author: AnkitA-488
title: Seriously, Go See "Dhurandhar" You Won't Regret It!
text:
Okay, guys, stop what you're doing and book tickets for Dhurandhar right now. I just saw it and I am completely obsessed it's an absolute blast! Honestly, I was hooked maybe five minutes into the opening sequence. If you've been waiting for a Bollywood spy thriller that actually delivers on its promise of non-stop action and genuine suspense, this is it.

Ranveer Singh as the titular agent? He was powerful! I mean, we know he's a great actor, but he brought such a raw intensity to this role. You can literally feel the weight of the world on his shoulders it was mesmerizing to watch. And can we talk about the antagonist? Akshaye Khanna absolutely crushed it. He has this calm, menacing vibe that made their confrontation scenes so incredibly gripping. Their dynamic is the engine of the movie, and it is firing on all cylinders.

I have to give huge props to the director, Aditya Dhar. He kept the pacing tight, even though it's a long movie it flew by! The action choreography felt real and gritty, not just some over-the-top CGI fest. Plus, the background score is just fantastic; it really amps up the suspense. I loved how the film wasn't just about explosions; it grounded the story in genuine human emotion, paying tribute to the sacrifices of our heroes.

Frankly, this film is a masterclass in making a huge-budget action spectacle feel authentic. It's a genuine winner and easily one of the best theater experiences I've had this year. Trust me on this one; you need to see this movie on the biggest screen possible!

author: JadejaY-2
title: Dhurandhar - A Bold, Gritty Return to Spy Thriller Grandeur
text:
Ranveer Singh's much-awaited comeback with Dhurandhar is a high-stakes, high-velocity spy thriller - ambitious in scope, heavy on scale, and unafraid to tread dark, violent paths. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film plunges audiences deep into the murky underworld of Karachi's mafia and the shadowy world of covert operations, borrowing from real-life events while weaving an intense fictional narrative.

One of the film's strengths is its ensemble cast. Alongside Ranveer Singh, actors like Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, R. Madhavan and Sara Arjun deliver solid performances that add weight and variety to the film's many layers. Critics and many viewers have particularly singled out Khanna's portrayal for offering a "masterclass" in villainy, while Ranveer plays a more subdued-but searing-spy whose moral compass and inner turmoil define much of the film's gravitas.

Visually and atmospherically, Dhurandhar excels. The film's world-building - its depiction of Karachi's underbelly, the cramped rooms, the smoky dens, the sense of paranoia and danger - feels immersive and convincing. The background score and sound design add to the tension and mood, often turning confrontations into thunderous cinematic moments.

But the film is not without flaws. Its runtime - around 3.5 hours - demands patience. The narrative occasionally falters: some sequences feel overly long, pacing dips in the second half, and certain violent or dramatic scenes verge on excess or rely on cinematic clich√©s that may strike some as heavy-handed or even jarring. Also, a few production limitations (notably in visual effects) and a sometimes predictable storyline keep it from being a flawless triumph.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a bold, often thrilling, occasionally exhausting cinematic ride - not just a movie, but a statement of scale. It's a film that asks a lot from its audience, yet gives back in tension, performances, and uncompromising ambition. For fans of gritty espionage thrillers and hard-hitting drama, it's a must-watch.

author: dhanushsai-25491
title: Dhurandhar: A Gripping Tale That Commands Your Attention
text:
Dhurandhar is one of those rare films that immediately pulls you into its world with a sense of intrigue and atmosphere that stays long after the credits roll. From the very first scene, the narrative establishes a mood that is both tense and deeply captivating, urging the audience to pay close attention to every detail. What sets Dhurandhar apart is not just its storyline, but the way it marries suspense, emotion, and intelligence into one cohesive experience.

The storytelling is exceptionally engaging. Instead of relying on predictable twists, Dhurandhar builds its tension through character depth, subtle clues, and emotionally grounded motivations. Each character feels real, layered, and purposeful, ensuring that even supporting roles add weight to the overall narrative. The protagonist's journey-filled with internal conflict, moral dilemmas, and moments of vulnerability-holds the audience's attention effortlessly. You don't just watch the character; you feel their struggle.

Visually too, the film stands strong. The cinematography enhances the intensity of every moment, whether it's a quiet emotional breakdown or a high-stakes confrontation. The lighting, framing, and pacing make the film feel almost like a visual novel-every shot contributing to the storytelling rather than just filling the screen.

What makes Dhurandhar truly captivating is its commitment to intelligence. The script respects the viewer's mind, giving space to interpret, analyze, and connect dots rather than spoon-feeding the spectacle. At the same time, it never becomes slow or overindulgent; instead, the film balances thought-provoking dialogues with thrilling sequences that keep you hooked from start to finish.

The background score deserves special mention. It amplifies emotions without overpowering them, subtly pushing the audience into the psychological tension of the plot. Combined with strong performances and well-crafted direction, the result is a cinematic experience that is both engaging and unforgettable.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a compelling watch-not just for thriller lovers, but for anyone who enjoys cinema that challenges the mind while entertaining the heart. It is captivating, engaging, and executed with remarkable finesse.

author: siddy-84663
title: Patriotism, Sacrifice, and Reality
text:
Dhurandhar is a gripping patriotic thriller that dives into the dangerous world of intelligence operations across the India-Pakistan border. The story follows a RAW agent on a covert mission deep inside Pakistan, showcasing the courage, strategy, and sacrifice required to protect the nation from unseen threats.

The film doesn't shy away from portraying the darker reality of state-sponsored terrorism and corruption, and it does so with a bold, unapologetic tone. The narrative keeps the tension high while highlighting the dedication of Indian intelligence forces. Performances are impactful, and the action sequences feel purposeful rather than over-the-top.

While the film clearly takes a strong nationalistic stance, its intent is to spotlight the realities faced by agents rather than simply entertain. A tighter runtime and slightly more nuanced character development could have elevated it further.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a powerful patriotic watch-engaging, intense, and thought-provoking for viewers who enjoy realistic espionage dramas with a strong emotional core.

author: amieshverma
title: Dhurandhar is a ruthless, raw masterpiece that shatters spy thriller norms.
text:
Dhurandhar is a ruthless, raw masterpiece that shatters spy thriller norms.

At a daunting 214 minutes, Dhurandhar grabs you from the first frame with a cinematic punch so fierce, it sets an unyielding tone for the entire epic. It isn't just an action thriller, it's a brutal deep-dive into the raw, unfiltered underbelly of cross-border terror and pain, something our screens desperately needed.

After the shelving of his ambitious Ashwathama, perhaps Dhar unleashed years of bottled rage and truth onto the silver screen, birthing Dhurandhar, a larger-than-life juggernaut exposing ISI's brutal reality, flipping the script on typical spy thrillers that often paint them as reluctant allies.

This film draws from real-life events, even threading in archival footage, pressing every nerve of anguish connected to terrorism's scars on India.

The film's strength lies in its uncompromising realism.

The fragile romance, the gut-wrenching, hard-hitting action choreography that makes Kill look tame, the razor-sharp dialogues, all elevate Dhurandhar to legendary status.

No character is short-changed, be it the heroes or the villains. Rakesh Bedi's portrayal of a tenacious Pakistani politician who bites back adds a juicy, unexpected layer of venom.

Visually and audibly, it's a marvel. The recreated retro soundtrack stirs nostalgia while propelling the movie's fierce tempo. The background score doesn't just accompany scenes, it becomes their beating heart, injecting life and urgency into every frame.

From the dense, shadowy alleys of Karachi to violent street battles, you're sucked into a world so vivid, its sheer 3 hours 34 minutes don't feel heavy but immersive.

Sanjay, Ramphal, Akshay, Madhavan, and Ranveer lead this charge with powerhouse performances that demand your attention. The script doesn't just entertain, it educates and punches with lines that linger as life lessons.

If Animal redefined contemporary action brutality, Dhurandhar rewrites the entire rulebook with raw emotion and relentless pace. Part one is a ticking time bomb of tension, teasing an explosive second chapter arriving on March 19, 2026.

The awaited sequel promises a brutal revenge saga India has never seen, weaponizing human demons and cinematic mastery with equal ferocity.

Yes, some will call this propaganda. But the brutal truth embedded in every frame silences cynics.

With Dhurandhar, Indian cinema isn't just keeping pace with Hollywood; it's storming the gates with unmatched storytelling finesse. Aditya Dhar, seven years after Uri, returns with a viciously slick narrative, flawless editing, and a killer soundtrack that will leave you breathless and begging for the next chapter.

A must-watch for anyone hungry for realistic, hard-hitting cinema that doesn't flinch from the truth making this a cinematic revolution. Watch it on the biggest screen possible. The fire it ignites on screen will be lit in your hearts too.

#dhurandhar #indiancinema #spythriller.

author: tomisaburo-77217
title: Must Watch!!! Bold, Unfiltered, and Long Overdue.
text:
Dhurandhar does what most Bollywood films never had the courage to do-show the reality without sugarcoating it. No safe storytelling, no forced "balance," no diplomatic gloss. Just the harsh truth of the conflict, presented with clarity.

Critics calling it "propaganda" are missing the point. The film isn't pushing an agenda; it's exposing what many already know but few dare to show. That discomfort is exactly why the label is being thrown around.

The performances are grounded, the writing is razor-sharp, and the direction keeps the tension tight from start to finish. No melodrama, no filler. The film respects the viewer's intelligence and refuses to talk down to them.

Technically solid and narratively fearless, Dhurandhar is worth watching simply because it's honest-and in today's landscape, honesty itself feels rebellious.

Must watch.

author: tosumitdhaka
title: A CINEMATIC MASTERSTROKE
text: Dhurandhar stands as a cinematic triumph that blends power, intellect, and raw emotion into a breathtaking experience. Directed with precision and vision, the film redefines the boundaries of Indian storytelling - merging cultural depth with world-class technical finesse. From its opening scene, the narrative commands attention and never lets go, drawing viewers into a world where morality is tested, genius clashes with ambition, and human resilience takes center stage. The film's protagonist, portrayed with magnetic intensity by the lead actor, delivers a performance that feels both grounded and transcendent. Each expression, pause, and dialogue carries the weight of lived experience. The supporting cast complements him beautifully - every secondary character adds a layer to the story's complexity rather than merely supporting it. Visually, Dhurandhar is a feast. The cinematography captures India's stark contrasts - from bustling cities to hauntingly quiet landscapes - with a painter's eye. The background score, subtle yet evocative, amplifies every emotional beat without ever overpowering it. The screenplay balances sharp intelligence with moments of silence that speak louder than words. What truly sets Dhurandhar apart is its theme - the internal battle between brilliance and conscience. It doesn't preach; it invites contemplation. By the time the credits roll, you're left both exhilarated and introspective, as if the story has etched itself into your conscience. In an era crowded with formulaic thrillers and superficial drama, Dhurandhar stands tall as a masterclass in intelligent cinema. It's a rare film that satisfies heart, mind, and soul - earning every bit of its five-star rating.

In the end, you truly understand why Ranveer Singh emerges as the hero who will carry the torch forward. With the next installment slated for March 19th, I'm already counting down the days. author: Tulcharam
title: Shandar jabardast
text:
Dhurandar" is an engaging and powerfully crafted film that impresses the audience with its storytelling, performances, and emotional depth. The movie revolves around the journey of an ordinary man who rises above challenges, struggles, and personal battles to become truly "dhurandar" - extraordinary in every sense. The narrative is inspirational and keeps the viewer connected from beginning to end.

The film's biggest strength lies in its acting performances. The lead actor delivers a remarkable portrayal, balancing vulnerability and strength with perfection. His expressions, dialogue delivery, and emotional range elevate the film to another level. Supporting actors also do full justice to their roles, adding realism and depth to every scene.

The direction is sharp and thoughtful. The filmmaker maintains a tight grip on the story, ensuring that every moment serves a purpose. The pacing is smooth - neither too fast nor too slow - allowing the audience to absorb the emotions and message of the film. The cinematography beautifully captures both the intensity and simplicity of the story's backdrop, enhancing the film's overall mood.

author: satendratomar-11687
title: Perfect
text:
In an era where spy films often rely on over-the-top action sequences and implausible plot twists, Dhurandhar emerges as a masterclass in espionage cinema. This is not just a good spy film-it's the perfect spy film, executed with precision, intelligence, and an unwavering commitment to authentic storytelling.

From the opening frame, director establishes a world where trust is currency and deception is an art form. The film follows its protagonist through a labyrinth of double-crosses and shadowy allegiances, yet never loses sight of the human cost of living a life built on lies. What sets Dhurandhar apart is its refusal to reduce espionage to mere spectacle. Every scene serves the narrative, every conversation bristles with subtext, and every action sequence feels earned rather than obligatory.

The lead performance anchors the film with remarkable nuance. We see a spy who is simultaneously hunter and hunted, calculating yet vulnerable. The supporting cast matches this intensity, creating a web of characters where motivations remain gloriously ambiguous until the final act. You're never quite sure who's playing whom, and that uncertainty becomes the film's greatest asset.

Technically, Dhurandhar is flawless. The cinematography captures both the glamour and grime of the spy world, moving effortlessly from elegant embassy halls to rain-soaked backstreets. The score pulses with tension without overwhelming the drama, knowing when to amplify and when to retreat into silence. The editing is surgical, maintaining a rhythm that keeps you leaning forward without exhausting you.

What truly elevates Dhurandhar to perfection is its intelligence. The screenplay trusts its audience, weaving together multiple storylines with clockwork precision. Information is revealed strategically, rewarding attentive viewers while never becoming convoluted. The film understands that the best spy thrillers are puzzles where the audience plays along, piecing together clues alongside the characters.

The climax delivers a payoff that feels both surprising and inevitable-the hallmark of exceptional thriller writing. Without resorting to cheap tricks or last-minute revelations that betray earlier logic, Dhurandhar brings its intricate plot threads together in a finale that satisfies on every level.

In Dhurandhar, we finally have a spy film that honors the genre's legacy while feeling thoroughly contemporary. It's tense, intelligent, stylish, and emotionally resonant. For fans of espionage cinema, this isn't just recommended viewing-it's essential. This is how spy films should be made.

title: A gripping patriotic thriller with powerhouse performances
text:
Dhurandhar is one of the most engaging spy thrillers to come out of Bollywood in a long time. The story pulls you in right from the first mission and rarely lets go, balancing tense action, emotion, and a strong patriotic vibe.

Ranveer Singh is outstanding in this role, completely disappearing into the character and giving both intensity and vulnerability. Akshaye Khanna is brilliant as the cold, calculating antagonist, and the supporting cast, including Sanjay Dutt, R. Madhavan, and Arjun Rampal, all add real weight to the film. The background score and slick cinematography make the world feel big and immersive, and several set pieces are genuinely clap worthy.

Yes, the runtime is long, but for me it never felt boring because the stakes keep rising and the final act lands emotionally. If you enjoy espionage, high stakes missions, and strong performances, Dhurandhar is definitely worth watching on the big screen. I would love to see more films in this universe.

author: rokokoio
title: Absolute Cinematic
text:
Dhurandhar is a cinematic masterpiece that sets a new benchmark for filmmaking. Despite a runtime of 3 hours and 32 minutes, the film never feels long. Once it begins, time simply disappears.

Chapter 1: Story-Driven, Not Star-Driven

Unlike most spy films or "superstar andhbhakt," Dhurandhar does not rely on star power. Yes, Ranveer Singh is a superstar, but here he is presented purely as an actor - nothing more, nothing less.

There is no aggressive star-centric marketing, no forced hero worship. The message is clear: watch the film for the experience, not for the star. This itself becomes one of the film's biggest strengths.

Chapter 2: "Aman Shaanti" Thrown in the Dustbin

Most spy films glamorize intelligence agencies - spies dancing in luxury clothes, romancing freely, and casually shaking hands with hostile organizations. Dhurandhar boldly rejects this fantasy.

The film shows the harsh reality of intelligence work while being careful not to generalize an entire nation. This balance is rare and mature, and it deserves appreciation.

Chapter 3: Spies Are Not Six-Pack Models

Since when did real spies need six-pack abs and designer goggles?

Take Ravindra Kaushik "The Black Tiger of India". One of India's greatest spies, he didn't live a glamorous life. He lived away from his family, changed his identity for 10 years, and silently served the nation. That is real espionage.

Dhurandhar understands this reality and respects it ,and that's what makes it special.

Chapter 4: Low Testosterone = "Asli Mard"

This film is not hypermasculine, and that is exactly why it understands masculinity better than most movies today.

Dhurandhar shows how a man should be, not how cinema has conditioned us to believe a man must perform. There are two moments in the film where raw masculine energy is displayed - no shouting, no exaggeration, no theatrics. I won't name them, because those moments work precisely due to their restraint.

Our history is proof that true masculinity was never about noise or domination. It was about: Control over oneself Responsibility over ego Silence when action is required That same masculinity is reflected in Dhurandhar.

Not the artificial kind shown in films where men are constantly proving they are "real men," but the grounded, disciplined masculinity that doesn't seek validation.

Modern cinema often mistakes aggression for manhood.

Dhurandhar reminds us that real men don't announce themselves - their actions do.

Chapter 5: "Violence Se Mujhe Dard Ho Raha Hai"

Yes, this film is violent - and yes, that violence is justified.

Why?

Because it is not inflicted on civilians, not driven by religion, caste, or community. The violence in Dhurandhar is directed strictly towards those who actively work against humanity and global peace.

The wire-torture scene shown in the trailer is disturbing - but it is real. Such methods have existed. They have been used. And what the film shows is not even one percent of that reality.

If the full truth of espionage and interrogation had been portrayed honestly, it would have been impossible to digest for normal audiences.

This is not violence for shock value.

This is violence as context, as consequence, as a reminder that peace is often protected by people who live in moral grey zones.

Discomfort is intentional here - because reality is uncomfortable.

author: fchrddb
title: A Rare Masterpiece That Brings the Magic Back
text:
It is rare to walk out of a cinema feeling like you just witnessed a turning point in film history. Dhurandhar is not just a movie, it is the reason people are flocking back to theaters. After years of watching content on small screens at home, this film reminds us why the big screen matters. It has single handedly brought back the thrill of a packed house and the shared energy of an audience.

Why It Works The strength of this film lies in its honesty. While many modern films get lost in complex side plots or forced agendas, Dhurandhar stays true to its core. It delivers a clear, hard hitting message without any fake narratives. It does not try to lecture you or twist the truth to fit a trend. Instead, it relies on top tier writing and raw, human performances.

The Highlights Sincere Storytelling: The plot is tight and every scene feels necessary. There is no fluff here.

Stunning Visuals: The cinematography is grand, making the cinema experience feel essential.

Authentic Tone: The film speaks a universal language of truth, which is the real cherry on top.

Final Thoughts We have been waiting for a movie like this to wake up the industry. It is bold, grounded, and incredibly well made. If you have lost your habit of going to the movies, this is the one to bring you back. It is a win for cinema and a win for the fans who value substance over style.

author: himanshubhushan-27324
title: Defining Moment for Indian Cinema
text:
A MONUMENTAL MASTERPIECE: WHY DHURANDHAR IS THE NEW GOLD STANDARD OF INDIAN CINEMA

In an era of fleeting trends and superficial spectacles, Dhurandhar emerges not just as a film, but as a seismic shift in the landscape of Indian storytelling. It is a sprawling, uncompromising, and titan-sized epic that demands your attention and earns every second of its near four-hour runtime. This isn't just a movie; it is an evocative, visceral experience that redefines what mainstream Bollywood is capable of achieving.

THE ARCHITECTURE OF BRILLIANCE

The most staggering feat of Dhurandhar is its meticulous construction. While most films falter under the weight of a long duration, the direction utilizes the runtime to weave a tapestry of incredible depth.

Immersive World-Building: The film doesn't just show you a story; it pulls you into a dense, atmospheric, and terrifyingly realistic world.

The Experimental Commercial Film: It manages a rare alchemy-retaining the aura and magnetic style of a blockbuster while grounding it in a clever, classy script that carries immense narrative weight.

GRITTY REALISM AND EMOTIONAL DEVASTATION

Dhurandhar is unapologetically dark, earning its 18 rating through unflinching honesty.

The 26/11 Sequence: This is arguably the most haunting depiction of the tragedy ever put to celluloid. It is a masterclass in evoking palpable shock and righteous fury, forcing the audience to confront the raw horror of the event with a sense of disgust and profound sadness.

Peak Performances: The acting is nothing short of high-artistry. Arjun Rampal, in particular, delivers a turn so chilling it transcends traditional drama, veering into the territory of a high-end psychological horror.

WHY IT CHANGES EVERYTHING

This film is a declaration that the Indian audience is ready for intelligent writing and complex morality. By ditching the standard tropes for gritty, realistic action and slow-burn tension, it sets a brand new precedent. It is cinema in its purest, most potent form-a film that stays with you long after the lights come up, simmering in your mind and challenging your soul.

THE VERDICT: Dhurandhar is a towering achievement. It is a brutal, beautiful, and brave masterpiece that marks the beginning of a new epoch in Bollywood. Do not miss it.

text:
The best spy film ever made in Indian cinema.

Worth watching.

Top notch performances of every actor specially Khanna Sir and Ranveer.

Dont miss it otherwise you will regret.

Dhurandhar roars onto screens like a thunderbolt, blending espionage grit with patriotic fire! Ranveer Singh as the undercover maestro is electric-raw, relentless, channeling Doval's daring with swagger that chills and thrills. Aditya Dhar's direction weaves real events (IC-814 hijack, Parliament attack) into a taut narrative, where shadows hide betrayals and every twist punches the gut.

Akshaye Khanna's steely IB chief and Sanjay Dutt's gritty Chaudhary Aslam steal scenes, while Sara Arjun's Yalina adds heart amid the chaos. Action sequences? Viciously visceral-fistfights in Karachi alleys feel bone-crunching real, VFX seamless. Score pulses with suspense, cinematography paints a brooding underworld.

At 3.5 hours, it demands commitment but repays with epic payoff. A landmark thriller that salutes unsung heroes-bold, immersive, unmissable! 10/10. Can't wait for Part 2!

author: tusharoct
title: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 10/10 TITLERaw, Brutal, and Absolutely Unmissable - The "Godfather" of Spy Thrillers!
text:
I just walked out of the theater, and I am trembling. If you thought "Uri: The Surgical Strike" was the peak of modern Indian war films, get ready to have your mind blown. "Dhurandhar" is not just a movie; it is an experience that grabs you by the throat in the first minute and doesn't let go for 3 hours and 34 minutes.

1. Ranveer Singh is a Force of Nature Forget the flamboyance; this is Ranveer stripped down to raw nerve and grit. He delivers a career-best performance that is haunting, intense, and terrifyingly real. You don't see the star; you only see the agent. His eyes speak volumes in the silent moments. This performance will be studied in acting schools.

2. The "Avengers" of Acting The casting director deserves an award.

* Akshaye Khanna brings that sharp, intellectual intensity that only he can.

* R. Madhavan is chillingly brilliant.

* Arjun Rampal and Sanjay Dutt add a weight and menace that elevates the stakes.

Every time these titans share the screen, the tension is suffocating.

3. Action That Hurts The 'A' rating is completely justified, and thank god for it! The action isn't the flying-car masala style; it is bone-crunching, bloody, and messy. It feels dangerous. You feel every punch and every bullet. It respects the audience's intelligence by showing the true cost of war and espionage.

4. A Masterclass in Direction Aditya Dhar proves he is the best in the business when it comes to high-stakes thrillers. The pacing is miraculous-despite being nearly 3.5 hours long, there is not a single dull moment. The screenplay weaves complex history (IC-814, Parliament attacks) into a narrative that is easy to follow but emotionally heavy.

5. Technical Brilliance The background score is thunderous yet emotional. The cinematography captures the gloom of the underworld and the dust of the battleground with equal beauty.

Verdict: Do not wait for OTT. This film demands the biggest screen and the loudest speakers you can find. It is patriotic without being jingoistic, violent without being gratuitous, and emotional without being melodramatic.

Dhurandhar is a masterpiece.

author: shahveer-58252
title: Dhar knows how to do spy movies right
text: Actual spy drama, showing the struggle of leaving your behind and adopting a fake identity. The struggle of fitting into a life that doesn't belong to you. Dhar shows the actual cruelty and the reality of the underworld and the political nexus, and the entire terrorism machinery. The movie is absolutely brutal and full of gore, yet it will make you watch all of it. Its a long movie yet no scene feels stretched or slow.

author: BansariP-56
title: The best movie I watched after very long time
text:
I watched Dhurandhar yesterday, and it's one of those films that keeps you completely hooked-there's literally no moment where your attention drifts. The pacing is tight, the tension is constant, and every scene pushes the story forward with purpose.

What really makes Dhurandhar powerful is how openly it links terror attacks on India to political decisions made during the UPA government era. The film presents a clear viewpoint, showing how weak policies, delayed decisions, and compromised national security frameworks created vulnerabilities that were later exploited by terrorist forces. It doesn't shy away from naming mistakes or questioning accountability, which gives the narrative a bold and unapologetic edge.

The screenplay is sharp and focused, with revelations that feel impactful rather than sensational. The direction ensures the message is delivered clearly while still maintaining the thrill of an espionage drama. Performances are intense and convincing, adding emotional weight to the political and security-related themes.

Overall, Dhurandhar is more than just a thriller it's a hard-hitting political commentary wrapped in a gripping cinematic experience. It makes you think, question, and reflect long after the film ends. Definitely a must-watch if you appreciate serious films that combine national security, politics, and suspense without playing safe.

author: monark-rathod
title: Awesome
text:
This is truly a "Real Spy Thriller." While the premise is widely known-an Indian spy enters Pakistan and brings them to their knees-the execution is spectacular.

Aside from the slightly long runtime, every department did a fabulous job, from cinematography and acting to dialogue and art direction. Aditya Dhar has proven himself once again; after Uri, he continues to show us what real cinema and true patriotism look like. Ignore the baseless negative reviews spreading online; this film is grounded in realism.

The Performances: Ranveer Singh is back with a bang, proving his mettle once again. However, Akshaye Khanna, Bollywood's most underrated actor, completely steals the show. R. Madhavan, Sanjay Dutt, and Arjun Rampal are also at their absolute best.

The Music & Rating: The music is the heart of the film, ensuring it never feels boring despite the length. The movie was released with an "A" certificate, but honestly, it deserves an "A+" for its brutality and strong language-so definitely keep children away.

If you are a fan of serious spy thrillers, go watch this extremely well-directed film. Mission "Dhurandhar" continues from March 19, 2026.

author: soumyasinghk
title: A narrative painted with passion, movement, and might
text: Dhurandhar grips the audience through its relentless realism and multi-layered storytelling. Ranveer Singh's portrayal of Hamza is magnetic, blending inner turmoil with tactical brilliance. Director Dhar exhibits command over pacing, ensuring tension never wanes despite the expansive runtime. The action sequences are meticulously choreographed, balancing brutality with cinematic elegance. Supporting actors provide a believable texture to the criminal underworld, making every interaction consequential. Combined with a suspenseful score and atmospheric cinematography, the film transcends traditional crime dramas to deliver a sophisticated cinematic experience.

author: MithunP-22
title: Absolutely Fantastic
text:
Dhurandhar delivers exactly what it promises an intense, well acted drama that holds its ground from start to finish. Despite its long runtime, the film rarely feels stretched; the storytelling stays engaging, and the performances are strong enough to keep you invested throughout. Yes, a couple of unnecessary songs slow the tempo, but they never derail the core narrative.

What truly elevates Dhurandhar is its cast. Every major performer brings weight and conviction to their role, grounding the film's emotional undercurrent. The characters don't feel like stock archetypes they feel lived in, shaped by decades of pain, loss, and resilience. That authenticity is the film's strongest asset.

Beyond craft, Dhurandhar stands out for something larger: its willingness to present an uncompromised Indian perspective on the long history of suffering caused by cross-border terrorism. For decades, the country has witnessed the consequences of Pakistan-backed militant activities, and this film does not shy away from confronting that reality. It brings the narrative back to the victims, the families, the soldiers, and the ordinary people who have paid the price.

India needs more films like this stories that aren't afraid to articulate our own experiences and trauma, stories that depict our side of history with honesty and emotional clarity. Dhurandhar succeeds not just as cinema but as a statement, one that resonates long after the credits roll.

author: harshawasthi90
title: A must watch - Best spy thriller bollywood has ever offered.
text:
The film runs for 3.5 hours, yet not for a moment does it lose momentum. It holds your attention with an almost hypnotic grip.

Special praise for the BGM. The way it blends with the narrative rhythm, and the way it rises and recedes with the tension, is genuinely masterful.

Outstanding performances Most compelling performances, in order:

Arjun Rampal - Major Iqbal Rakesh Bedi - Jameel Jamali Akshaye Khanna - Rehman Dakait Ranveer Singh - Hamza Ali Mazhari Madhavan - Ajay Sanyal

The tight close-up shots, especially the ones capturing Ranveer Singh's micro-expressions, are brilliantly executed.

The production design feels remarkably authentic. Even the green-screen sequences have a level of realism rarely seen in mainstream cinema.

What I particularly appreciate is the film's unapologetic portrayal of Pakistan and the ISI.

This is a refreshing change from the sanitised, commercially driven narratives seen in Jawan, Ek Tha Tiger, and similar franchises.

When the film ended, it genuinely caught me off-guard.

It felt as though I did not want it to conclude, because the rising momentum had created such an immersive flow.

Please watch it.

Support it.

Make it a blockbuster,

so that more filmmakers gain the confidence to attempt bold and uncompromised storytelling...

author: beluga69
title: Dhurandhar - A Pulse-Pounding Masterpiece That Redefines the Spy Genre
text:
Forget everything you think you know about Indian spy thrillers-Dhurandhar isn't just another entry in the genre; it's a seismic shift. Directed with surgical precision by Aditya Dhar, this film merges raw realism with cinematic grandeur, delivering a story that's as emotionally resonant as it is relentlessly intense.

From the opening frame, Dhurandhar grips you with its authenticity. Shot with a documentary-like grit yet layered with poetic tension, the film weaves through shadowy terror networks, volatile gang rivalries, and moral gray zones-never once sacrificing heart for hype. The screenplay unfolds like a ticking time bomb: deliberate, coiled, and devastatingly effective. Each scene adds weight, not just to the plot, but to the souls of its characters.

Ranveer Singh delivers a career-defining performance-transformative, restrained, and electrifying. He doesn't just play his character; he becomes him, erasing every trace of stardom to embody a man caught between duty and despair. The supporting cast is nothing short of phenomenal: Akshaye Khanna's chilling precision, Sanjay Dutt's weathered gravitas, Arjun Rampal's quiet intensity, and R. Madhavan's nuanced resolve all elevate the narrative. Even in brief appearances, actors like Sara Arjun and Manav Gohil leave lasting impressions-proof of the film's meticulous casting.

One sequence, in particular, lingers long after the credits: a harrowing attack rendered in blood-red hues, underscored by ghostly voice recordings that send shivers down your spine. It's bold, haunting, and emblematic of Dhar's fearless storytelling-where sound design, color, and silence speak as loudly as dialogue.

Dhurandhar is more than a movie-it's an experience. Best watched in a dark theater with an audience holding its breath. And that ending? Pure cinematic bait. March 2026 can't come soon enough.

Verdict: 10/10 - Not just the best film of 2025 so far, but a new benchmark for Indian cinema.

author: Aman1SharmaJii
title: Style, Substance, and Sharp Storytelling
text:
I watched Dhurandhar today, and honestly, it's a film that pulls you in slowly and then refuses to let go.

What really works in the film is the way the story moves forward chapter by chapter. Each character is introduced with care, and their backstories are given enough time to breathe. That buildup pays off, because as the film progresses, the plot becomes more intense and aggressive in its own quiet way.

Akshaye Khanna is the real star of the show. His performance is restrained, sharp, and deeply engaging-he owns every scene he's in. Ranveer Singh, on the other hand, is decent but familiar. There are shades of his earlier work, especially Padmaavat. That said, his emotional moments are strong, and he delivers well when the film demands intensity.

The theatre experience adds a lot to the vibe. The background score, the retro songs, and the overall sound design hit the right notes and elevate many scenes. Sanjay Dutt's character, however, feels a bit repetitive. It's a role we've seen him play before-the tough, authoritative figure-and it doesn't offer much that's new.

A big surprise for me was the Pakistan-set portions. Among all the characters, Arjun Rampal stands out with the most convincing accent. He isn't perfect in every scene, but his consistency makes a difference. R. Madhavan is another major highlight. As the narrator, he brings depth and calm to the storytelling. His subtle hints toward the idea of a "new India" reflect Aditya Dhar's worldview, something we've seen in his previous work as well.

The post-credit scene is a treat and leaves a strong impact. And the final fight sequence featuring Ranveer Singh is completely unexpected it's raw, intense, and adds a powerful closing note to the film.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a well-packaged theatrical experience with strong performances, a gripping narrative style, and moments that stay with you after the credits roll. It's not perfect, but it's engaging, confident, and definitely worth watching on the big screen.

author: VivekA-687
title: Drama So Strong It Lingers, Action So Big It Stuns
text: From the opening moments, the film establishes a tense, immersive atmosphere. Ranveer Singh delivers a performance of rare depth, portraying internal conflict with subtlety and strength. Sanjay Dutt dominates his scenes with formidable presence, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan contribute sharp, layered performances. Arjun Rampal embodies controlled menace, and Sara Arjun's emotional resonance enhances the stakes. Director Aditya Dhar combines strategic plotting with thrilling action sequences, maintaining engagement throughout the runtime. Cinematography captures both sprawling urban chaos and intimate character moments, while the sound design heightens suspense. The film's climax fuses intensity and emotional depth to powerful effect.

author: advikrai
title: One of the finest Bollywood espionage thrillers to emerge in half a decade
text:
I went into the theatre extremely sceptical. I had loved URI and liked Article 370 (produced by URI and Dhurandhar's director Aditya Dhar). The runtime of the movie and the controversies surrounding it only served to lower my expectations further.

Amazingly, this is one of the finest written and executed action-spy movies; if not the finest; bollywood has given us in the past decade.

Each character is written and developed in a way that makes you connect with them. You feel for them. The story is presented through chapters, and each chapter does a fantastic job of tying the narrative together as a whole.

Ranveer Singh was excellent in the movie, but for me personally, Akshaye Khanna stole the show. A once in a generation performance from him.

Acting ranking: Akshaye Khanna > Ranveer Singh > R. Madhavan > Arjun Rampal > Sanjay Dutt You know your movie is packed with acting powerhouses when even the weakest performance among the leads still comes from Sanju Baba.

The writing, direction, acting, cinematography, sound design, action (holy gore!), and almost everything else you can think of are outstanding. Despite being this awesome, the film will still entertain you more than any other Bollywood release this year.

Negatives (at least the few there are):
  • CGI: It's fine in most scenes but gets wonky in a few portions. It still surprises me that Bollywood can't produce good-looking blood VFX even today!


  • Runtime: The first half (2 hours) flies by and you enjoy every minute. But when you return after the interval for the remaining 1.5 hours, you'll definitely feel it "could've been shorter", though not to the point of boredom.


8.25/10. 100% recommended.

author: jigar-42
title: Must Watch Movie
text:
The performances by Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, and R. Madhavan are absolutely top-notch. The film never feels lengthy; every scene keeps you glued to your seat and fully engaged throughout.

The direction and acting are exceptional. The movie powerfully highlights real incidents involving the Congress/UPA government and its failure to take decisive action during critical moments such as the circulation of counterfeit Indian currency and the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. It portrays how the government was ineffective in ruling the country and appeared to sympathize with terrorists instead of acting firmly in the nation's interest.

Hats off to Aditya Dhar for making such a hard-hitting film that opens the eyes of Indians. It's unfortunate that some anti-national elements oppose this movie. One has to wonder-why would anyone who truly loves the nation object to a film that exposes terrorism and its roots in Pakistan?
